00051   */
00052 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00053   * @brief  Initializes peripherals used by the SPI flash driver.
00054   * @retval None
00055   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00056 u32 SPI_FLASH_Init(void)
00057 {
00058   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00059      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00060      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00061   */
00062   SPI_InitTypeDef  SPI_InitStructure;
00063 
00064   /*  Enable AFIO & SPI SEL pin port & SPI clock                                                            */
00065   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00066   FLASH_SPI_SEL_CLK(CKCUClock) = 1;
00067   FLASH_SPI_CLK(CKCUClock)     = 1;
00068   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO           = 1;
00069   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00070 
00071   /*  Configure SPI SEL pin                                                                                 */
00072   GPIO_SetOutBits(GPIO_PORT[FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_ID], FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_PIN);
00073   GPIO_DirectionConfig(GPIO_PORT[FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_ID], FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DIR_OUT);
00074 
00075   #if defined(USE_HT32F50343)
00076   FLASH_SPI_MOSI_CLK(CKCUClock) = 1;
00077   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00078   GPIO_DriveConfig(GPIO_PORT[FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_ID], FLASH_SPI_SEL_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DV_8MA);
00079   GPIO_DriveConfig(GPIO_PORT[FLASH_SPI_SCK_GPIO_ID], FLASH_SPI_SCK_AFIO_PIN, GPIO_DV_8MA);
00080   GPIO_DriveConfig(GPIO_PORT[FLASH_SPI_MOSI_GPIO_ID], FLASH_SPI_MOSI_AFIO_PIN, GPIO_DV_8MA);
00081   #endif
00082 
00083   /*  Configure SPI SCK pin, SPI MISO pin, SPI MOSI pin                                                     */
00084   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(FLASH_SPI_SCK_GPIO_ID, FLASH_SPI_SCK_AFIO_PIN, FLASH_SPI_SCK_AFIO_MODE);
00085   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(FLASH_SPI_MISO_GPIO_ID, FLASH_SPI_MISO_AFIO_PIN, FLASH_SPI_MISO_AFIO_MODE);
00086   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(FLASH_SPI_MOSI_GPIO_ID, FLASH_SPI_MOSI_AFIO_PIN, FLASH_SPI_MOSI_AFIO_MODE);
00087   #if defined(USE_HT32F52367_SK) || defined(USE_HT32F0006)
00088   #if defined(USE_HT32F61355_56_57)
00089   #else
00090   /*  Configure QSPI SIO2 pin, QSPI SIO3 pin                                                                */
00091   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(FLASH_SPI_SIO2_GPIO_ID, FLASH_SPI_SIO2_AFIO_PIN, FLASH_SPI_SIO2_AFIO_MODE);
00092   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(FLASH_SPI_SIO3_GPIO_ID, FLASH_SPI_SIO3_AFIO_PIN, FLASH_SPI_SIO3_AFIO_MODE);
00093   #endif
00094   #endif
00095 
00096   /*  SPI Configuration                                                                                     */
00097   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_Mode = SPI_MASTER;
00098   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_FIFO = SPI_FIFO_DISABLE;
00099   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_DataLength = SPI_DATALENGTH_8;
00100   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_SELMode = SPI_SEL_SOFTWARE;
00101   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_SELPolarity = SPI_SELPOLARITY_LOW;
00102   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_FirstBit = SPI_FIRSTBIT_MSB;
00103   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_CPOL = SPI_CPOL_HIGH;
00104   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_CPHA = SPI_CPHA_SECOND;
00105   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_RxFIFOTriggerLevel = 0;
00106   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_TxFIFOTriggerLevel = 0;
00107   #if (LIBCFG_MAX_SPEED > 48000000)
00108   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_ClockPrescaler = 4;
00109   #else
00110   SPI_InitStructure.SPI_ClockPrescaler = 2;
00111   #endif
00112   SPI_Init(FLASH_SPI, &SPI_InitStructure);
00113 
00114   #if (!LIBCFG_SPI_NO_MULTI_MASTER)
00115   SPI_SELOutputCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00116   #endif
00117 
00118   SPI_Cmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00119 
00120   return TRUE;
00121 }
00122 
00123 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00124   * @brief  Erases the specified FLASH sector.
00125   * @param  SectorAddr: address of the sector to erase.
00126   * @retval None
00127   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00128 void SPI_FLASH_SectorErase(u32 SectorAddr)
00129 {
00130   /* Send write enable instruction                                                                          */
00131   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00132 
00133   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00134   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00135   /* Send "Sector Erase" instruction                                                                        */
00136   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_SE);
00137   /* Send high byte address of SectorAddr                                                                   */
00138   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((SectorAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00139   /* Send medium byte address of SectorAddr                                                                 */
00140   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((SectorAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00141   /* Send low byte address of SectorAddr                                                                    */
00142   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SectorAddr & 0xFF);
00143   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00144   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00145 
00146   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00147   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00148 }
00149 
00150 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00151   * @brief  Erases the specified FLASH block.
00152   * @param  BlockAddr: address of the block to erase.
00153   * @retval None
00154   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00155 void SPI_FLASH_BlockErase(u32 BlockAddr)
00156 {
00157   /* Send write enable instruction                                                                          */
00158   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00159 
00160   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00161   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00162   /* Send "Block Erase" instruction                                                                         */
00163   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_BE);
00164   /* Send high byte address of BlockAddr                                                                    */
00165   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((BlockAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00166   /* Send medium byte address of BlockAddr                                                                  */
00167   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((BlockAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00168   /* Send low byte address of BlockAddr                                                                     */
00169   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(BlockAddr & 0xFF);
00170   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00171   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00172 
00173   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00174   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00175 }
00176 
00177 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00178   * @brief  Erases the entire FLASH.
00179   * @retval None
00180   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00181 void SPI_FLASH_ChipErase(void)
00182 {
00183   /* Send write enable instruction                                                                          */
00184   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00185 
00186   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00187   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00188   /* Send "Chip Erase" instruction                                                                          */
00189   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_CE);
00190   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00191   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00192 
00193   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00194   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00195 }

00197 #ifdef HT_PDMA
00198 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00199   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH with a single WRITE cycle by DMA.
00200   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00201   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00202   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00203   * @retval None
00204   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00205 void SPI_FLASH_PageWriteByDMA(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00206 {
00207   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00208      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00209      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00210   */
00211   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_TX;
00212   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_RX;
00213   u32 uSPITxDmaChNumber;
00214   u32 uSPIRxDmaChNumber;
00215   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPITxDmaCh;
00216   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPIRxDmaCh;
00217   u32 blkcnt = NumOfWriteByte;
00218   u32 maxcnt = 65535;
00219   u8 rxBuffer;
00220   /*  Enable PDMA clock                                                                                     */
00221   {
00222     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00223     CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA = 1;
00224     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00225   }
00226 
00227   /* Enable the write access to the FLASH                                                                   */
00228   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00229 
00230   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00231   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00232   /* Send "Page Program" instruction                                                                        */
00233   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WRITE);
00234   /* Send high byte address of WriteAddr                                                                    */
00235   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00236   /* Send medium byte address of WriteAddr                                                                  */
00237   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00238   /* Send low byte address of WriteAddr                                                                     */
00239   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(WriteAddr & 0xFF);
00240 
00241   /* Intial PDMA Parameter                                                                                  */
00242   if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI0)
00243   {
00244     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_RX;
00245     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_TX;
00246     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_RX * 6 * 4);
00247     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_TX * 6 * 4);
00248   }
00249   #ifdef HT_SPI1
00250   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI1)
00251   {
00252     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_RX;
00253     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_TX;
00254     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_RX * 6 * 4);
00255     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_TX * 6 * 4);
00256   }
00257   #endif
00258   #ifdef HT_QSPI
00259   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_QSPI)
00260   {
00261     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_RX;
00262     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_TX;
00263     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_RX * 6 * 4);
00264     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_TX * 6 * 4);
00265   }
00266   #endif
00267   /* SPI Master Tx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00268   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) WriteBuffer;
00269   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00270   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00271   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00272   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00273   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_LIN_INC | DST_ADR_FIX;
00274 
00275   /* SPI Master Rx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00276   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00277   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &rxBuffer;
00278   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00279   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00280   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_Priority = VH_PRIO;
00281   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_FIX;
00282 
00283   while (blkcnt)
00284   {
00285     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00286     {
00287       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00288       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00289     }
00290     else
00291     {
00292       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00293       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00294     }
00295 
00296     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Tx                                                                           */
00297     PDMA_Config(uSPITxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_TX);
00298 
00299     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Rx                                                                           */
00300     PDMA_Config(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_RX);
00301 
00302     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPITxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00303     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00304     /* Start Transmission data                                                                              */
00305     SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, ENABLE);
00306 
00307     /* Waiting for Tramsmission Finsih                                                                      */
00308     while ((SPITxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00309     while ((SPIRxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00310     #if (ENABLE_LOW_POWER == 1)
00311     __WFI();
00312     #endif
00313 
00314     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00315       blkcnt -= maxcnt;
00316     else
00317       blkcnt = 0;
00318   }
00319 
00320   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00321   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00322   SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, DISABLE);
00323 
00324   /* Wait the end of Flash writing                                                                          */
00325   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00326 }
00327 #endif
00328 
00329 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00330   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH with a single WRITE cycle.
00331   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00332   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00333   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00334   * @retval None
00335   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00336 void SPI_FLASH_PageWrite(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00337 {
00338   /* Enable the write access to the FLASH                                                                   */
00339   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00340 
00341   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00342   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00343   /* Send "Page Program" instruction                                                                        */
00344   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WRITE);
00345   /* Send high byte address of WriteAddr                                                                    */
00346   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00347   /* Send medium byte address of WriteAddr                                                                  */
00348   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00349   /* Send low byte address of WriteAddr                                                                     */
00350   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(WriteAddr & 0xFF);
00351 
00352   while (NumOfWriteByte--)
00353   {
00354     /* Send the current byte                                                                                */
00355     SPI_FLASH_SendByte(*WriteBuffer);
00356     /* Point on the next byte to be written                                                                 */
00357     WriteBuffer++;
00358   }
00359 
00360   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00361   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00362 
00363   /* Wait the end of Flash writing                                                                          */
00364   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00365 }
00366 
00367 #ifdef HT_QSPI
00368 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00369   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH with a quad WRITE cycle.
00370   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00371   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00372   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00373   * @retval None
00374   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00375 void QSPI_FLASH_QuadPageWrite(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00376 {
00377   /* Enable the write access to the FLASH                                                                   */
00378   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00379 
00380   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00381   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00382 
00383   /* Send "Quad Page Program" instruction                                                                   */
00384   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_4PP);
00385 
00386   /* Send 6 Address cycle                                                                                   */
00387   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_2);
00388   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00389   QSPI_DirectionConfig(FLASH_SPI, SIO_DIR_OUT);
00390   /* Send high byte address of WriteAddr                                                                    */
00391   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00392   /* Send medium byte address of WriteAddr                                                                  */
00393   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00394   /* Send low byte address of WriteAddr                                                                     */
00395   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(WriteAddr & 0xFF);
00396 
00397   while (NumOfWriteByte--)
00398   {
00399     /* Send the current byte                                                                                */
00400     SPI_FLASH_SendByte(*WriteBuffer);
00401     /* Point on the next byte to be written                                                                 */
00402     WriteBuffer++;
00403   }
00404 
00405   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00406   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00407 
00408   /* Disable quad port and reconfigure data frame length                                                    */
00409   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
00410   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_8);
00411 
00412   /* Wait the end of Flash writing                                                                          */
00413   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00414 }
00415 #endif
00416 
00417 #if defined (HT_QSPI) && defined (HT_PDMA)
00418 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00419   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH with a quad WRITE cycle by DMA.
00420   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00421   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00422   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00423   * @retval None
00424   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00425 void QSPI_FLASH_QuadPageWriteByDMA(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00426 {
00427   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_TX;
00428   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_RX;
00429   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPITxDmaCh;
00430   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPIRxDmaCh;
00431   u32 uSPITxDmaChNumber;
00432   u32 uSPIRxDmaChNumber;
00433   u32 blkcnt = NumOfWriteByte;
00434   u32 maxcnt = 65535;
00435   u8 rxBuffer;
00436 
00437   /*  Enable PDMA clock                                                                                     */
00438   {
00439     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00440     CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA = 1;
00441     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00442   }
00443 
00444   /* Enable the write access to the FLASH                                                                   */
00445   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
00446 
00447   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00448   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00449 
00450   /* Send "Quad Page Program" instruction                                                                   */
00451   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_4PP);
00452 
00453   /* Send 6 Address cycle                                                                                   */
00454   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_2);
00455   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00456   QSPI_DirectionConfig(FLASH_SPI, SIO_DIR_OUT);
00457   /* Send high byte address of WriteAddr                                                                    */
00458   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00459   /* Send medium byte address of WriteAddr                                                                  */
00460   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((WriteAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00461   /* Send low byte address of WriteAddr                                                                     */
00462   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(WriteAddr & 0xFF);
00463 
00464   /* Intial PDMA Parameter                                                                                  */
00465   uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_RX;
00466   uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_TX;
00467   SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_RX * 6 * 4);
00468   SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_TX * 6 * 4);
00469 
00470   /* SPI Master Tx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00471   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) WriteBuffer;
00472   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00473   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00474   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00475   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00476   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_LIN_INC | DST_ADR_FIX;
00477 
00478   /* SPI Master Rx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00479   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00480   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &rxBuffer;
00481   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00482   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00483   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_Priority = VH_PRIO;
00484   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_FIX;
00485 
00486   while (blkcnt)
00487   {
00488     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00489     {
00490       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00491       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00492     }
00493     else
00494     {
00495       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00496       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00497     }
00498 
00499     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Tx                                                                           */
00500     PDMA_Config(uSPITxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_TX);
00501 
00502     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Rx                                                                           */
00503     PDMA_Config(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_RX);
00504 
00505     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPITxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00506     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00507 
00508     /* Start Transmission data                                                                              */
00509     SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, ENABLE);
00510 
00511     /* Waiting for Tramsmission Finsih                                                                      */
00512     while ((SPITxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00513     while ((SPIRxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00514     #if (ENABLE_LOW_POWER == 1)
00515     __WFI();
00516     #endif
00517 
00518     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00519       blkcnt -= maxcnt;
00520     else
00521       blkcnt = 0;
00522   }
00523 
00524   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00525   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00526 
00527   SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, DISABLE);
00528 
00529   /* Disable quad port and reconfigure data frame length                                                    */
00530   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
00531   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_8);
00532 
00533   /* Wait the end of Flash writing                                                                          */
00534   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
00535 }
00536 #endif
00537 
00538 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00539   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH by CallBack function
00540   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00541   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00542   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00543   * @param  pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun : Callback function. Page Write interface.
00544   * @retval None
00545   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00546 void SPI_FLASH_BufferWriteBy(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte, pWriteFunction pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun)
00547 {
00548   u8 NumOfSingle = 0, Addr = 0, Count = 0, tmp = 0;
00549   u16 NumOfPage = 0;
00550 
00551   Addr = WriteAddr % SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00552   Count = SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE - Addr;
00553   NumOfPage =  NumOfWriteByte / SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00554   NumOfSingle = NumOfWriteByte % SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00555 
00556   if (Addr == 0)
00557   {
00558     if (NumOfPage == 0)
00559     {
00560       pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, NumOfWriteByte);
00561     }
00562     else
00563     {
00564       while (NumOfPage--)
00565       {
00566         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE);
00567         WriteAddr +=  SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00568         WriteBuffer += SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00569       }
00570       if (NumOfSingle)
00571       {
00572         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, NumOfSingle);
00573       }
00574     }
00575   }
00576   else
00577   {
00578     if (NumOfPage == 0)
00579     {
00580       if (NumOfSingle > Count)
00581       {
00582         tmp = NumOfSingle - Count;
00583 
00584         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, Count);
00585         WriteAddr +=  Count;
00586         WriteBuffer += Count;
00587 
00588         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, tmp);
00589       }
00590       else
00591       {
00592         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, NumOfWriteByte);
00593       }
00594     }
00595     else
00596     {
00597       NumOfWriteByte -= Count;
00598       NumOfPage =  NumOfWriteByte / SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00599       NumOfSingle = NumOfWriteByte % SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00600 
00601       pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, Count);
00602       WriteAddr +=  Count;
00603       WriteBuffer += Count;
00604 
00605       while (NumOfPage--)
00606       {
00607         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE);
00608         WriteAddr +=  SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00609         WriteBuffer += SPI_FLASH_PAGESIZE;
00610       }
00611 
00612       if (NumOfSingle)
00613       {
00614         pSPI_FLASH_PageWriteFun(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, NumOfSingle);
00615       }
00616      }
00617    }
00618 }
00619 
00620 #ifdef HT_PDMA
00621 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00622   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH by DMA.
00623   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00624   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00625   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of bytes to read from the FLASH.
00626   * @retval None
00627   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00628 void SPI_FLASH_BufferReadByDMA(u8* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00629 {
00630   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00631      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00632      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00633   */
00634   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_TX;
00635   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_RX;
00636   u32 uSPITxDmaChNumber;
00637   u32 uSPIRxDmaChNumber;
00638   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPITxDmaCh;
00639   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPIRxDmaCh;
00640   u32 blkcnt = NumOfReadByte;
00641   u32 maxcnt = 65535;
00642   u8 spi_dummy_data = SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE;
00643   /*  Enable PDMA clock                                                                                     */
00644   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00645   CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA                            = 1;
00646   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00647 
00648   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00649   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00650 
00651   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00652   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_READ);
00653   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00654   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00655   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00656   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00657   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00658   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00659 
00660   /* Intial PDMA Parameter                                                                                  */
00661   if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI0)
00662   {
00663     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_RX;
00664     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_TX;
00665     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_RX * 6 * 4);
00666     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_TX * 6 * 4);
00667   }
00668   #ifdef HT_SPI1
00669   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI1)
00670   {
00671     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_RX;
00672     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_TX;
00673     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_RX * 6 * 4);
00674     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_TX * 6 * 4);
00675   }
00676   #endif
00677   #ifdef HT_QSPI
00678   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_QSPI)
00679   {
00680     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_RX;
00681     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_TX;
00682     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_RX * 6 * 4);
00683     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_TX * 6 * 4);
00684   }
00685   #endif
00686 
00687   /* SPI Master Tx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00688   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &spi_dummy_data;
00689   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00690   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00691   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00692   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00693   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_FIX;
00694 
00695   /* SPI Master Rx PDMA channel configuration                                                               */
00696   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00697   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) ReadBuffer;
00698   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00699   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
00700   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_Priority = VH_PRIO;
00701   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_LIN_INC;
00702 
00703   while (blkcnt)
00704   {
00705     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00706     {
00707       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00708       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00709     }
00710     else
00711     {
00712       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00713       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00714     }
00715 
00716     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Tx                                                                           */
00717     PDMA_Config(uSPITxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_TX);
00718 
00719     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Rx                                                                           */
00720     PDMA_Config(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_RX);
00721 
00722     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPITxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00723     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00724 
00725     /* Start Transmission data                                                                              */
00726     SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, ENABLE);
00727 
00728     #if (ENABLE_LOW_POWER == 1)
00729     __WFI();
00730     #endif
00731 
00732     /* Waiting for Tramsmission Finsih                                                                      */
00733     while ((SPITxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00734     while ((SPIRxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00735     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00736       blkcnt -= maxcnt;
00737     else
00738       blkcnt = 0;
00739   }
00740   SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, DISABLE);
00741 
00742   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00743   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00744 }
00745 #endif
00746 
00747 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00748   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH.
00749   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00750   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00751   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of bytes to read from the FLASH.
00752   * @retval None
00753   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00754 void SPI_FLASH_BufferRead(u8* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00755 {
00756   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00757   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00758 
00759   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00760   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_READ);
00761   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00762   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00763   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00764   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00765   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00766   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00767 
00768   while (NumOfReadByte--)
00769   {
00770     /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                           */
00771     *ReadBuffer = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00772     /* Point to the next location where the byte read will be saved                                         */
00773     ReadBuffer++;
00774   }
00775 
00776   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00777   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00778 }
00779 
00780 #if (!LIBCFG_SPI_NO_DUAL)
00781 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00782   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH using Dual Output Mode.
00783   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00784   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00785   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of half words to read from the FLASH.
00786   * @retval None
00787   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00788 void SPI_FLASH_BufferDualRead(u16* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00789 {
00790   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00791   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00792 
00793   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00794   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_DREAD);
00795   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00796   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00797   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00798   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00799   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00800   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00801 
00802   /* Enable Dual Port                                                                                       */
00803   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00804 
00805   /* Send dummy byte                                                                                        */
00806   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00807 
00808   while (NumOfReadByte--)
00809   {
00810     /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                           */
00811     *ReadBuffer = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00812     /* Point to the next location where the byte read will be saved                                         */
00813     ReadBuffer++;
00814   }
00815 
00816   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00817   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00818 
00819   /* Disable Dual Port                                                                                      */
00820   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
00821 }
00822 #endif

00824  #ifdef HT_PDMA
00825 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00826   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH using Dual Output Mode by DMA.

00829   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of half words to read from the FLASH.
00830   * @retval None

00832 void SPI_FLASH_BufferDualReadByDMA(u16* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00833 {

00835      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00836      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00837   */
00838   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_TX;
00839   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_RX;
00840   u32 uSPITxDmaChNumber;

00843   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPIRxDmaCh;
00844   u32 blkcnt = NumOfReadByte;
00845   u32 maxcnt = 65535;
00846   vu8 spi_dummy_data = SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE;

00849   CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA                            = 1;
00850   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00851   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00852   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00853 
00854   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00855   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_DREAD);
00856   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00857   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00858   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00859   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00860   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00861   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00862 
00863   /* Enable Dual Port                                                                                       */
00864   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00865 
00866   /* Send dummy byte                                                                                        */
00867   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00868

00870   if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI0)
00871   {
00872     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_RX;
00873     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI0_TX;
00874     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_RX * 6 * 4);
00875     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI0_TX * 6 * 4);
00876   }
00877   #ifdef HT_SPI1
00878   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_SPI1)
00879   {
00880     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_RX;
00881     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_SPI1_TX;
00882     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_RX * 6 * 4);
00883     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_SPI1_TX * 6 * 4);
00884   }
00885   #endif
00886   #ifdef HT_QSPI
00887   else if (FLASH_SPI == HT_QSPI)
00888   {
00889     uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_RX;
00890     uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_TX;
00891     SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_RX * 6 * 4);
00892     SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_TX * 6 * 4);
00893   }
00894   #endif
00895   /* SPI0 Master Tx PDMA channel configuration                                                              */
00896   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &spi_dummy_data;
00897   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00898   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;

00900   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00901   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_FIX;
00902 
00903   /* SPI0 Master Rx PDMA channel configuration                                                              */
00904   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
00905   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &ReadBuffer[0];
00906   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
00907   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_16BIT;
00908   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_Priority = VH_PRIO;
00909   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_LIN_INC;
00910 
00911   while (blkcnt)
00912   {
00913     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00914     {
00915       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00916       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
00917     }
00918     else
00919     {
00920       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00921       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
00922     }
00923 
00924     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Tx                                                                           */
00925     PDMA_Config(uSPITxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_TX);
00926 
00927     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Rx                                                                           */
00928     PDMA_Config(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_RX);
00929 
00930     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPITxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00931     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
00932 
00933     /* Start Transmission data                                                                              */
00934     SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, ENABLE);
00935 
00936     #if (ENABLE_LOW_POWER == 1)
00937     __WFI();
00938     #endif
00939 
00940     /* Waiting for Tramsmission Finsih                                                                      */
00941     while ((SPITxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00942     while ((SPIRxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
00943     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
00944       blkcnt -= maxcnt;
00945     else
00946       blkcnt = 0;
00947   }
00948   SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, DISABLE);
00949   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00950   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00951 
00952   /* Disable Dual Port                                                                                      */
00953   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
00954 }
00955 #endif
00956 
00957 #ifdef HT_QSPI
00958 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00959   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH using Quad Output Mode.
00960   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00961   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00962   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of half word (16-bit) to read from the FLASH.
00963   * @retval None
00964   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00965 void QSPI_FLASH_BufferQuadRead(u16* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00966 {
00967   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00968   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00969 
00970   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00971   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_QREAD);
00972   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00973   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00974   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00975   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00976   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00977   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00978 
00979   /* Enable Quad Port                                                                                       */
00980   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_4);
00981   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00982   QSPI_DirectionConfig(FLASH_SPI, SIO_DIR_IN);
00983 
00984   /* Send 8 dummy cycle                                                                                     */
00985   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00986   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00987 
00988   while (NumOfReadByte--)
00989   {
00990     /* Read 2 bytes from the FLASH                                                                          */
00991     *ReadBuffer = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00992     /* Point to the next location where the byte read will be saved                                         */
00993     ReadBuffer++;
00994   }
00995 
00996   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00997   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00998 
00999   /* Disable quad port and reconfigure data frame length                                                    */
01000   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
01001   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_8);
01002 }
01003 #endif
01004 
01005 #if defined (HT_QSPI) && defined (HT_PDMA)
01006 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01007   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH using Quad Output Mode by DMA.
01008   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
01009   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
01010   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of half word (16-bit) to read from the FLASH.
01011   * @retval None
01012   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01013 void QSPI_FLASH_BufferQuadReadByDMA(u16* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
01014 {
01015   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_TX;
01016   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure_RX;
01017   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPITxDmaCh;
01018   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *SPIRxDmaCh;
01019   u32 uSPITxDmaChNumber;
01020   u32 uSPIRxDmaChNumber;
01021   u32 blkcnt = NumOfReadByte;
01022   u32 maxcnt = 65535;
01023   vu8 spi_dummy_data = SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE;
01024 
01025   /*  Enable PDMA clock                                                                                     */
01026   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
01027   CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA = 1;
01028   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
01029 
01030   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01031   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01032 
01033   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
01034   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_QREAD);
01035   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
01036   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
01037   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
01038   SPI_FLASH_SendByte((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
01039   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
01040   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
01041 
01042   /* Enable Quad Port, input mode                                                                           */
01043   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_4);
01044   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
01045   QSPI_DirectionConfig(FLASH_SPI, SIO_DIR_IN);
01046 
01047   /* Send 8 dummy cycle                                                                                     */
01048   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01049   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01050 
01051   /* Intial PDMA Parameter                                                                                  */
01052   uSPIRxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_RX;
01053   uSPITxDmaChNumber = PDMA_QSPI_TX;
01054   SPIRxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_RX * 6 * 4);
01055   SPITxDmaCh = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_QSPI_TX * 6 * 4);
01056 
01057   /* QSPI Tx PDMA channel configuration                                                                     */
01058   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &spi_dummy_data;
01059   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
01060   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
01061   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_8BIT;
01062   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
01063   PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_FIX;
01064 
01065   /* QSPI Rx PDMA channel configuration                                                                     */
01066   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32) &FLASH_SPI->DR;
01067   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32) &ReadBuffer[0];
01068   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkLen = 1;
01069   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_16BIT;
01070   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_Priority = VH_PRIO;
01071   PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_AdrMod = SRC_ADR_FIX | DST_ADR_LIN_INC;
01072 
01073   while (blkcnt)
01074   {
01075     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
01076     {
01077       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
01078       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = maxcnt;
01079     }
01080     else
01081     {
01082       PDMACH_InitStructure_TX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
01083       PDMACH_InitStructure_RX.PDMACH_BlkCnt = blkcnt;
01084     }
01085 
01086     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Tx                                                                           */
01087     PDMA_Config(uSPITxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_TX);
01088 
01089     /* PDMA configuration, SPI Rx                                                                           */
01090     PDMA_Config(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, &PDMACH_InitStructure_RX);
01091 
01092     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPITxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
01093     PDMA_EnaCmd(uSPIRxDmaChNumber, ENABLE);
01094 
01095     /* Start Transmission data                                                                              */
01096     SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, ENABLE);
01097 
01098     #if (ENABLE_LOW_POWER == 1)
01099     __WFI();
01100     #endif
01101 
01102     /* Waiting for Tramsmission Finsih                                                                      */
01103     while ((SPITxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
01104     while ((SPIRxDmaCh->CTSR&0xFFFF0000) != 0);
01105     if (blkcnt >= maxcnt)
01106       blkcnt -= maxcnt;
01107     else
01108       blkcnt = 0;
01109   }
01110 
01111   SPI_PDMACmd(FLASH_SPI, SPI_PDMAREQ_TX | SPI_PDMAREQ_RX, DISABLE);
01112 
01113   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01114   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01115 
01116   /* Disable quad port and reconfigure data frame length                                                    */
01117   QSPI_QuadCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
01118   SPI_SetDataLength(FLASH_SPI, SPI_DATALENGTH_8);
01119 }
01120 #endif
01121 
01122 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01123   * @brief  Reads JEDEC ID.
01124   * @retval JEDEC ID value.
01125   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01126 u32 SPI_FLASH_ReadJEDECID(void)
01127 {
01128   u32 Temp = 0, Temp0 = 0, Temp1 = 0, Temp2 = 0;
01129 
01130   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01131   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01132 
01133   /* Send "JEDEC Read-ID" instruction                                                                       */
01134   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_RDID);
01135 
01136   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
01137   Temp0 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01138 
01139   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
01140   Temp1 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01141 
01142   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
01143   Temp2 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01144 
01145   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01146   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01147 
01148   Temp = (Temp0 << 16) | (Temp1 << 8) | Temp2;
01149 
01150   return Temp;
01151 
01152 }
01153 
01154 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01155   * @brief  Writes the new value to the Status Register.
01156   * @param  Value : the new value to be written to the Status Register.
01157   * @retval None
01158   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01159 void SPI_FLASH_WriteStatus(u32 Value)
01160 {
01161   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
01162 
01163   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01164   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01165 
01166   /* Send "Write Status Register" instruction                                                               */
01167   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WRSR);
01168   /* Writes to the Status Register                                                                          */
01169   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(Value);
01170 
01171   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01172   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01173 
01174   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
01175   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd();
01176 }
01177 
01178 #ifdef HT_QSPI
01179 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01180   * @brief  Writes the new value to the Status Register.
01181   * @param  Value : the new value to be written to the Status Register.
01182   * @retval None
01183   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01184 u8 SPI_FLASH_WriteStatus2(u8 Status_Value, u8 Configuration_Value)
01185 {
01186   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable();
01187 
01188   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01189   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01190 
01191   /* Send "Write Status Register" instruction                                                               */
01192   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WRSR);
01193   /* Writes to the Status / Configuration Register                                                          */
01194   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(Status_Value);
01195   /* Writes to the Status / Configuration Register                                                          */
01196   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(Configuration_Value);
01197 
01198   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01199   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01200 
01201   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
01202   return (SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd());
01203 }
01204 #endif
01205 
01206 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01207   * @brief  Sends a byte through the SPI interface and return the byte received from the SPI bus.
01208   * @param  byte : byte to send.
01209   * @retval The value of the received byte.
01210   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01211 u16 SPI_FLASH_SendByte(u8 byte)
01212 {
01213   /* Loop while Tx buffer register is empty                                                                 */
01214   while (!SPI_GetFlagStatus(FLASH_SPI, SPI_FLAG_TXBE));
01215 
01216   /* Send byte through the SPIx peripheral                                                                  */
01217   SPI_SendData(FLASH_SPI, byte);
01218 
01219   /* Loop while Rx is not empty                                                                             */
01220   while (!SPI_GetFlagStatus(FLASH_SPI, SPI_FLAG_RXBNE));
01221 
01222   /* Return the byte read from the SPI                                                                      */
01223   return SPI_ReceiveData(FLASH_SPI);
01224 }
01225 
01226 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01227   * @brief  Enables the write access to the FLASH.
01228   * @retval None
01229   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01230 void SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable(void)
01231 {
01232   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01233   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01234 
01235   /* Send "Write Enable" instruction                                                                        */
01236   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WREN);
01237 
01238   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01239   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01240 }
01241 
01242 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01243   * @brief  Disables the write access to the FLASH.
01244   * @retval None
01245   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01246 void SPI_FLASH_WriteDisable(void)
01247 {
01248   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01249   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01250 
01251   /* Send "Write Disable" instruction                                                                       */
01252   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_WRDI);
01253 
01254   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01255   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01256 }
01257 
01258 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01259   * @brief  Polls the status of the BUSY flag in the FLASH's status register and waits for the end of Flash
01260             writing.
01261   * @retval The value of the Status Register.
01262   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01263 u8 SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd(void)
01264 {
01265   u8 FLASH_Status = 0;
01266 
01267   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
01268   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
01269 
01270   /* Send "Read Status Register" instruction                                                                */
01271   SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_CMD_RDSR);
01272 
01273   /* Loop as long as the busy flag is set                                                                   */
01274   do
01275   {
01276     /* Send a dummy byte to generate the clock to read the value of the status register                     */
01277     FLASH_Status = SPI_FLASH_SendByte(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
01278 
01279   } while ((FLASH_Status & SPI_FLASH_BUSY_FLAG) == SET);
01280 
01281   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
01282   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
01283 
01284   return FLASH_Status;
01285 }

01287   * @}
01288   */

01292   * @}
01293   */
01294

01296   * @}
01297   */
01298 
01299 /**
01300   * @}
01301   */
